task.title: Linking with Related Links in DITA

taskbody.context: To create a list of related links within the topic you are editing (as opposed to specifying relationships externally with a relationship table) follow these steps:

step.cmd: Open the topic in which you want the link to occur in Author mode.
Select one of the related link actions from the Link drop-down menu that is available on the DITA toolbar. You can choose between the following types of related links:

choices.choice: Related Link to Topic - Opens an Insert Reference dialog box that allows you to select a reference. Inserts a link element inside a related-links parent.
Related Link to File - Opens an Input URL dialog box that allows you to select a file. Inserts a link element with the format attribute set to xml inside a related-links parent.

Related Link to Web Page - Opens an Input URL dialog box that allows you to select a web link. Inserts a link element with the attribute format set to html and scope set to external inside a related-links parent.

taskbody.result: This creates a related links section at the bottom of your topic. DITA provides the linklist and linkpool elements to help you refine how your links are created and processed. See the DITA documentation for details.
